entry.title: Astrophytum Capricorn Major (Goat's Horn)

Although strange looking and rare, the Goat's horn cactus is one of the most popular cacti from the Astrophytum genus (Astrophytum Capricorne). Yellow flowers with a red center may bloom during summer.

entry.title: Astrophytum Ornatum (Monk's Hood Cactus)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.99

Astrophytum ornatum is native to the canyons and limestone cliffs of Mexico. Star-shaped, it has dark green flesh and woolly scales. It’s one of the largest and easiest and fast-growing cacti to grow.

entry.title: Euphorbia Pseudoglobesa
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne

Euphorbia pseudoglobosa is a dwarf spineless succulent that looks like a cactus, eventually forming a subterranean caudex. It forms thick mats of dwarf spineless segmented stems up to 20 cm in diameter. Euphorbia are generally easy to care for.

entry.title: Austrocylindropuntia subulata f. cristate
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.99

Formerly referred to as Opuntia subulata cristata, its common name is Crested Eve's Needle. This cactus is a crested form of Eve's Needle where the stems fan outward into different wavy shapes topped with combs of long emerald green succulent leaves. This form does not bloom. They are slow-growing and can reach up to 1-2 feet tall.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo

 No

entry.title: Euphorbia Tortilis Variegata 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 19.99

There are thousands of different species of Euphorbia, each quite different and unique. Euphorbia tortilis grows into a tree-like plant with a twisting stem covered in small thorns.

As with many other Euphorbia species, the latex from the plant is poisonous and can cause skin irritations.  Despite it's thorny protection, it is best to keep it out of reach of animals! 

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Full sun
 Water thoroughly when the soil is completely dry
 Small pink or yellow flowers
 Toxic to animals
 Growth: Upright, up to 1m
 Origin : India
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Pilocereus Azureus "Blue Torch" 4"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.99

Cereus are the well known columnar cacti that are native to Latin America. Cereus azureus has greenish-grey stems and grows in groups of several stems. They are slow-growers but are considered quite easy to care for. Watering should be infrequent, especially during the winter months. When it finally comes time to water, it is best to water thoroughly.

Although many cacti can be very large in their natural habitat, they stay much smaller in indoor conditions.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Full sun
 Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry
 Impressive, white-pink flowers
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth: Columnar, up to 2m
 Origin : Central, South America
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Echinocactus Platyacanthus
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 29.99

Echinocactus platyacanthus is sometimes known as the giant barrel cactus. In nature, this slow-growing species can reach sizes up to 2.5 tall and 1.5 m wide and can live over a hundred years. This species changes in appearance completely over the course of its lifetime. It starts its life as a powdery blue orb, sometimes with purple striations.

entry.title: Myrtillocactus Geometrizans
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 15.99

Myrtillocactus geometrizans, also known as blue candle cactus or blue myrtle cactus, is a plant from the Cactaceae family, native to Central and Northern Mexico. This fast-growing cactus can make a unique indoor plant. Its stems are spiky and blueish green in color, with a waxy feel. As the plant matures, the stems take a candelabra-like look, with thick clusters growing upwards. This cactus variety also produces edible berries, which are greatly enjoyed as a snack in Mexico.
  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Full sun to partial shade
 Water when soil is completely dry
 Small creamy green or yellow flowers
 Non toxic
 Growth: Columnar, up to 5m
 Origin : Mexico
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Parodia Leninghausii
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99 - 14.99 (2 variants)

Parodia are small cacti that grow into a wide, cylindrical shape. They are usually solitary, although they may branch out to form a small cluster. These cacti require slightly more water and less direct sun than most other cacti.

Parodia Leninghausii is also known as the Golden Torch Cactus, Yellow Tower or Eriocactus leninghausii.  It is an attractive cactus appreciated for its long, harmless golden spines.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 2.5" or 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 A few hours of direct sun
 Water when soil is completely dry
 Yellow, up to 6 cm
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth : Columnar, 1 m tall
 Origin : Brazil
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Astrophytum Myriotigma Tricostatum 4"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 49.99

Astrophytum myriostigma (many dots) is a spineless cactus. Its completely distinct look resembles a bishop’s hat. 'Tricostatum' refers to its three ribs. The plant become columnar with age. It is covered with many minute white hairy scales that give it a characteristic chalk-white or silvery-grey appearance. These plants are perfect for a desk or a windowsill as they are extremely slow growers and prefer small pots. 

  • You will receive the plant in the photos
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots

 Origin : Mexico
